Line 219: Line 212:
[[pl:Pozdrowienia z Rosji - henchmani]]
[[pl:Pozdrowienia z Rosji - henchmani]]
â   â   â   â   â
Mortimer;
  â
Affiliation: SPECTRE;
  â
Portrayed by: unknown
  â   â
Mortimer is a fictional character in the James Bond film From Russia With Love and is uncredited.
  â   â
Mortimer is the mute bodyguard of Morzeny (coincidentally both of their names start with 'm') and never strays far from Morzeny's side. The only time Mortimer is not seen at Morzeny's shoulder is when Morzeny enters Blofeld's boathouse although this is likely since Blofeld doesn't allow anyone but full-time SPECTRE agents in. Mortimer first appears in the opening sequence when he takes the James Bond mask off of a strangle SPECTRE agent whom Donald Red Grant just killed.
  â   â
He later appears when Rosa Klebb visits SPECTRE Island in order to enlist Grant in a scheme to kill Bond once again at Morzeny's shoulder. He appears between the 2 SPECTRE agents when they walk through the training area and he humorously ducks as a piece of cardboard blown apart by a grenade launcher goes whizzing through the air.
  â   â
Mortimer seems to harbor the cold killer stereotype although this is never proven except in one scene when a man accidentally almost kills Morzeny with a boulder he was aiming at some targets for improvised weaponary and whilst Morzeny just warns him, "Never do it again," Mortimer snaps his neck once Morzeny has turned his back. Despite this he does have his limits as demonstrated when Grant walks up to Morzeny, Klebb and Mortimer he (Mortimer) is shown slightly quivering indicating that the only person he is afraid of is Grant.
  â   â
Mortimer's loyalty to Morzeny aides in his demise as he accompanies Morzeny on the boat chase across the Mediterranean Sea chasing Bond. Here he operates a mounted machine gun and here it's revealed that he's apparently a good marksman as demonstrated when his bullets goes whizzing across Bond's shoulder which is what makes him improvise rather than try to evade Morzeny, Mortimer and the others. Thus Bond empties several fuel barrels into the water and after the boats get into the same general area Bond fires several flares creating a blazing inferno. Whilst several soldiers jump off their boats so as to swim back to land despite Morzeny's yells to keep on shooting at Bond Mortimer remains loyal to his employer to the end and thus keeps on firing his machine gun at Bond even when Bond is out of range. Although Mortimer isn't actually seen dead it's likely since he refused to leave he would have died in the inferno.
  â   â   â   â
Reno;
  â
Affiliation: Self-Employed/SMERSH
  â
Portrayed by: Peter Bayliss
  â   â
Reno is a fictional character in the James Bond film From Russia With Love portrayed by Peter Bayliss. He is a crime lord in Istanbul and is recruited by Krilencu a SMERSH agent to raid a gypsy camp in an attempt to kill James Bond and Ali Kerim Bey. Ironically his actor is the same as Benz who is indirectly his employer since Krilencu works for Benz and he works for Krilencu somehwat.
  â   â
At Reno's suggestion Krilencu recruits not only the Turkish Hit Squad (Reno's gang) but the Istanbulian mafia led by Don Zabutsky so as to have a private army to raid the gypsy camp. Notably if one looks closely he does look a lot like Benz although this is disguised by making Reno scruffy, wear an eyepatch (most likely from a gang fight or something of the like) and wears bum-like clothes as opposed to Benz who is well-dressed.
  â   â
When the private army invades the gypsy camp where Bond and Bey are he shows that he is a remarkable fighter as opposed to the cowardly Don Zabutsky who chooses to stay up in the stone walls rather than go on the ground and fight. Here it's demonstrated that Reno is a dangerous man as he kills several of the defenders at the camp with nothing more than a club and apparently is seen killing at least 5 people and probably more. After killing another man he goes after Bond and probably would've killed him. Unbeknownst to Reno however SPECTRE is using Bond to get themselves a Lektor Decoding Device and thus need him alive so Donald Red Grant who's being Bond's 'guardian angel' hides out in the stone towers and whilst nonchalantly sipping tea shoots Reno in the chest killing him before continuing sipping tea. Bond notices Reno's corpse and briefly looks around for the person who killed him before shrugging it off and going after some more attackers.
  â   â   â   â
Don Zabutsky
  â
Affiliation: Self-Employed/SMERSH
  â
Portrayed by: Peter Brayham
  â   â
Don Zabutsky is a fictional character in the James Bond film From Russia Wtih Love portrayed by Peter Brayham. Notably Brayham also portrayed another SMERSH agent (although it's directly and not indirectly as in Zabutsky's case) Rhoda although the producers hid this. In contrast to the scruffy and bum-like Reno who portrayed the well-dressed Benz Rhoda also looked bum-like, wore an overcoat and had the tips of his moustache missing whilst Zabutsky wears a tuxedo and has his hair slicked back.
  â   â
Zabutsky is the head of the Istanbulian mafia and was recruited by Krilencu in a raid on a gypsy camp in order to kill James Bond and Ali Kerim Bey which he agreed to. Unlike Reno who did so readily Zabutsky was seconds away from having Krilencu killed before seeing that Reno was with him thus implying that although Reno is of another gang Zabutsky is friends with or at the very least tolerant of him. He then supplies most of the members of the mafia (who forced him to come along) and along with the entire Turkish Hit Squad (led by Reno) and some disposable SMERSH agents supplied by Benz led the raid on the gypsy camp along with Krilencu and Reno which made up somewhat of an army.
  â   â
Notably despite Zabutsky and Reno appearing to be friends they do have a stark contrast in more ways than one. Aside from the dress-up of the two Reno is street-wise and talks with a slang accent (it's also implied that he curses although this never occurred to avoid an R rating) whilst Zabutsky is mild-mannered and talks with a slight Italian accent. Another contrast is their attitude towards fighting: whilst Reno willingly leads his men into battle Zabutsky tends to have his men fight his battles for him as he only came when the rest of his mafia pointed their guns at him saying they wanted 3 leaders. Even then instead of jumping down from the stone walls surrounding the camp like everyone else including Reno and Krilencu he stays up on the walls and instead fires down at people from below.
  â   â
This leads to his death as when he's about to kill Vavra the owner of the camp Bond shoots him in the chest and although it's unknown if this is what killed him the recoil causes him to trip and fall over the side of the walls into the small river below. After Vavra thanks Bond he (Vavra) shoots several more bullets where the ripples of Zabutsky's fall was ensuring his death. Upon seeing Zabutsky's death from afar and looking at Reno's corpse Krilencu flees the camp with what few attackers are left. It's unknown if the remaining members of the Turkish Hit Squad and Istanbulian Mafia (provided the fact that the few people who escaped weren't entirely SMERSH agents) were executed for failure or continued their crime spree following Zabutsky's and Reno's deaths.
